comments.commentBody: Thank you President Obama for watching out for OUR country.

replies.commentBody: Your comment indicates that you don't care that Russia interfered with our Democratic process of open and fair elections. That's unbelievable.

comments.commentBody: Grow up.  The U.S. has interfered or attempted to do so in elections in almost every country in the world.  We have funded coups, revolutions, counter revolutions from day one.  When we didn't like the election we tried....well everything.  And, the point is...please, gentle readers, ask yourselves are you more upset about the leaks or what the leaks revealed.  Personally, both are equally disgusting...almost.  I think the leaked information is a tad nastier.  No wonder HrC is in virtual hiding.

OK, I'll propose it.

From here on out, in our country it'll be referred to as Trump Salad Dressing.

For that down home robust Russian Flava for your Salad.

Given the dearth of reporting about Obama and Valerie Jarrett's radical associations one would have thought that the Times had forgotten how to actually ask a question or how to question a narrative which has been presented.
While the Republicans are stalling, those who have something to hide are busy erasing their hard drives and deep-sixing their thumb-drives. No time to lose.
Just another reason why he was the greatest president in modern times.

Aa Citizens we must have the courage to face what may come ahead.
Our Constitution is strong and we must steel ourselves to follow this through and investigate. Time for a Special Prosecutor and a full Congressional Investigation.

After Trump's speech and miraculous "change" in tone, could it be that some in the media have finally figured out how to look past his shenanigans and just stick to reporting on his and his cohorts actions? Well done, NYT.

All the news today - about how the intelligence needed to be spread around and protected, about the way we learned Sessions had contact with the Russians through DOJ sources, the House Republicans trying to intimidate leakers by investigating them as much as Russian interference - points in one direction. It all says, We do not have confidence in the FBI.
We'd see no leaks or need to spread intel around, if there were still confidence in the FBI to do a thorough, non-partisan job. By emphasizing their investigation of Clinton, hiding their investigation of Trump, and being quite careful never to actually investigate anything that would require a look into Trump's business ties and tax returns, the FBI needs to be investigated as much as anything else in this sorry mess.

Obviously all the Trump haters assume he's guilty of treason. Reminds me of the legions of Obama haters of a year ago. Different President, but same conduct among those given over to the hate.
Sure would be enlightening to see some empirical proof of this grand conspiracy amid all the rumor and innuendo...

Nice to see that Jeff Sessions wanted to get in practice -Lying - and not even waiting until he became Attorney General. Can Jeff say Special Prosecutor?

Of course really the Only Question is - WHY was Anyone associated with the trump campaign speaking to anyone from the Russian Government Before their candidate had taken the Oath (you remember Oaths right Jeff?) of Office?

What is it about Republican candidates representatives talking with Foreign Governments BEFORE their guy actually becomes president???
First Nixon, then Reagan & now trump & still people continue to vote Republican??? And lets not even talk about When was the last time that Republicans in Congress initiated legislation to Help the Middle Class and/or Poor? And people Still continue to vote Republican???
comments.userLocation: Off-Grid Solar Community south of Madrid New Mexico

replies.commentBody:
Newsweek has learned that senior staffers in the Trump administration are using a private RNC email server. This is the same private email server used by the Bush administration that claimed it lost 22 million emails.

“Senior Trump administration staffers including Kellyanne Conway, Jared Kushner, Sean Spicer and Steve Bannon have active accounts on a Republican National Committee email system,” Newsweek reported Wednesday.

Newsweek noted dryly “… after then-candidate Donald Trump and the Republicans repeatedly called for ‘locking up’ Hillary Clinton for handling government work with a private server while secretary of state, the new White House staff risks repeating the same mistake that dogged the Democrat’s presidential campaign. They also face a security challenge: The RNC email system, according to U.S. intelligence, was hacked during the 2016 race. ‘They better be careful after making such a huge ruckus over the private email over at the State Department,’ says former Bush administration lawyer Richard Painter.”

Well yes, that’s awkward. But here’s betting you won’t see the media getting hysterical over the Trump administration’s use of a private email server.

Of course, it has yet to be proven that they are using the private server to hide from transparency records. All emails on the private server that have to do with government business are supposed to be forwarded to the government email address so they can be archived properly.

comments.commentBody:
A - why do some people think our elections are this fragile? especially those who refuse photo ID requirements to vote
B - where is the evidence that Russia has any serious ability to deceive us like this? what does that say about the CIA/FBI/NSA et al?
C - Russia was granted Most Favored Nation status by Clinton in 1996 - and NOW that's a problem?
D - does ANYONE think Obama/DNC/Hillary would NOT use any and all ammo against Trump PRIOR to the election?
E - just about the only thing that seems clear is that Hillary's criminal use of her own email server gave Russia (and China and others) full insight into thousands of sensitive emails

Beam me up - no intelligent life on this "news" site

comments.commentBody: This is the "birther movement" for Democrats. Not to say that Trump didn't have it coming...
Where would we be without you, NYT? Nevermind, I can't fathom it. There's enough keeping me up at night these days.

replies.commentBody:
Just as bad is that the same people who support Trump and his ties to Putin are also excoriating President Obama and the intelligence agencies for making sure the information was available! This behavior is possibly treasonous, yet they support it!

Obama and the intelligence agencies are patriots - thank you!

comments.commentBody:
I find it incredible that there are people that actually believe that a man that has constantly praised Putin while many times denigrating his own country and its intelligence agencies is not a traitor.
Am I suppose to now believe that his associates met with Russian diplomats and oligarchs that only exist at Putin's will, but Trump knew nothing about it?
Is this the same Trump that has said first that he met with Putin and then that he didn't meet with hi. The same Trump that will not release his tax returns so that his business ties with Russia cannot be examined?
It seems that we have forgotten that we are americans first, not liberals or conservatives, not left or right, not democrats or republicans, we are one people, americans.
Our country was attacked, our election was compromised, the Russians did it and Trump is involved, stop the denial, the excuses and stand up for our country THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

If these meetings are as routine as Sessions claims, it should be fairly easy to determine how many other members of the Senate Armed Services Committee held private meetings with the Russian ambassador during this period.

Sessions, like Flynn, has also had plenty of time to clarify his testimony and "demurred".

The stench coming from the Trump administration about their relationship with our historic enemy will only get worse. They've been played. It is up to Congress to assure that our entire country doesn't fall into the same hole. I'm optimistic they will do so.

replies.commentBody: Trump is actually the "useful idiot"  here. Now Putin and company have a stooge in place in the highest level of our government. Nice going Comrad Josh.
You have it backwards.  It was Trump and his team that were (are) useful idiots for the Russians.
You should submit this to Izvestiya

comments.commentBody:
I voted for Trump. And I couldn't care less if the Russians were "useful idiots"--to quote an old Soviet expression--to Trump's team. Trump was shrewd enough to steal a page out of shady Hillary's playbook. Through her vast network of fraud and corruption (aka the Clinton Foundation), Hillary and her wayward husband Bill took large donations from nefarious families and donor from around the world. Where was the outcry from the media about Hillary? We didn't hear much about the fraudster Hillary because the mass media was busy fabricating a massive lead and predicting a 99% of winning for the DNC while it defamed Trump in the 24-hour newsfeed.

Meanwhile, back in the White House, Obama was busy obstructing a peaceful transition of power. He ended his unsuccessful second term in office in much the same way he started it--by dividing Americans. But this time his racial and religious opportunism took a back seat to his underhand political moves. Obama's massive ego, self-aggrandizing "legacy" and ideological liberalism always took precedent over what was best for America and the American people.

replies.commentBody: You believe that's why Flynn resigned so quickly or should've resigned so quickly?

We the people aren't brainwashed by this stuff any more.

In October 2016 Obama told us that it was 'impossible for the election to be hacked', yet now we find out he left a trail of documents about 'supposed' Russian intervention.

Obama is a phony and a fraud. He is not a friend to liberals.

comments.commentBody: Mr Obama's records should be confiscated. He has no security clearances any longer. He's engaging in criminal activity at the highest levels. He may even be subject to arrest by accepting stolen intelligence data from DOJ.

Flynn’s conversation with the Russians covered sanctions, and suggested that the Trump administration would be rolling back the sanctions in the future. That means that Flynn had been actively trying to undermine Obama administration policy while not yet in office — a big, questionably legal no-no. Indeed, the FBI is investigating the content of the Flynn calls.

As for Sessions, he lied and committed perjury in a congressional hearing. He’s the United States Attorney General. They’re not supposed to lie (that’s an understatement in case it wasn’t clear).

The Russians did indeed hack the DNC servers; it's been validated and Republicans have confirmed this.

How can you defend this behavior and continue to believe these continual lies? Likely Fox, Breitbart and InfoWars....

comments.commentBody:
So what. It is not unusual for campaigns running for president talking to foreign countries. It is well documented that in 2008, Obama's campaign was communicating with the Iran government who were sanctioned, and conspiring against the U.S. just like Russia.

No matter how hard the NY Times tries to smear Trump who has made the NY Times look foolish at every turn, the NY Times has zero evidence Trump's people did anything illegal.

This Russian garbage came up as a diversion to cover up the Wikileaks emails that exposed the fact Clinton, and the DNC had rigged the election process against Sanders. The NY Times has said nothing or expressed any outrage at Clinton, and the DNC rigging the election process. The NY Times immediately pushed the Russian hack claim to help their candidate Clinton.

replies.commentBody: what s good for Clinton Is good for Trump. Lock them up together?

comments.commentBody:
Let's see, are these the same democrats who were outraged when Hillary Clinton set up a private email server to avoid FOIA requests, deleted emails and took steps to wipe her server after she was ordered to preserve all work related emails? The same democrats who demanded an investigation into the coordinated attempt to lie and deceive the American public about the Benghazi attack being a response to a YouTube video?

Those guys?

I love how the comments below continue with a narrative and yet are clueless to the laws that govern. When a political insider, and foreign government collude it is called TREASON. When a political insider, and national agencies collude to disrupt, prevent, destroy the administration and existing government it is called SEDITION or SUBVERSION. The people of this nation are so self consumed and drunk from the koolaide they have no idea of what reality is. Sessions, in his capacity as a SENATOR held meetings along with other members of the Obama admin with the Russians. This is business as usual. When a political appointee, Jarrett, and NSA Rice are making government decisions this is outside the scope of their offices. When Clinton is lying to congress, building shadow networks, and disclosing sensitive information for political and monetary favors, all of turn a blind eye. Wake up people.

replies.commentBody: It's what I've always said, rightist's are un-American trash.

comments.commentBody: The saddest thing in all this is that my friends and family who voted for Trump largely don't care about the Russia-Trump connections.  They read alternative news feeds that right now are expressing jubilation over getting some former Clinton-campaign/Obama staffer named Grilo fired for his negative tweet about the Navy Seal widow.  I am so disappointed in my fellow citizens. How has it come to this?

Looking from abroad, our country has become the epitome of a banana Republic. It's time to dismantle the Trump regime! Treasonous acts have and ARE being committed. Party's OVER! The fat lady has sung.

I wonder why in 2008 there was no investigation into who orchestrated the run on the banks that sank the world's economy and assured the election of Obama? Supposedly Obama knew about the hacking months ago but did nothing because he didn't want to pull attention away from the election he was sure Hillary would win. Trump didn't need Russia to win the primaries and he didn't need Russia to win the election. The reason he won was because he had two or three rallies in two or three states every day while Hillary was going to $10,000 a plate fundraisers and pretty much ignoring the voters she thought she had in the bag. She found out too late the bag had a hole in it.
